The capacity of an organism to withstand prolonged submergence in a layer of particulate matter, allowing it to recover and continue growth after exposure has ceased, often permitting its presence to be underestimated in environments where such conditions are common.
total length: The extent to which an organism can maintain its integrity and continue to grow or recover after being completely covered by a layer of sediment, measured by the length of its vegetative structures.
